description.p: You replace your wizard’s spellbook with tattoos etched upon your body. These living etchings serve as your grimoire. When you prepare wizard spells, the tattoos on your body shift and realign, glowing faintly with arcane light.

When you find a spell, you can inscribe it onto your skin by spending 2 hours and 25 gp per level of the spell. If your tattoos are ever destroyed, you can recreate them during a long rest at the same cost and time as replacing a lost spellbook.

sheet.description: Inscribing a spell onto your body as a tattoo costs 2 hours and 25 gp per spell level. Destroyed tattoos can be recreated during a long rest at the same cost and time as a lost spellbook.

description.p: You gain the ability to inscribe a magical tattoo onto one willing creature other than yourself at the end of a long rest. The tattoo lasts until you finish your next long rest. When you inscribe the tattoo, choose one of the following effects:

ul.li: Ward of Ink. The creature gains a +2 bonus to AC.
Strike of Ink. Once per turn, when the creature hits with a weapon attack, it deals extra damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
Glyph of Vigor. At the start of each of its turns, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

description.p: As a bonus action, the creature can activate the tattoo, causing it to flare with arcane power for 1 minute. Once activated, the tattoo’s magic is expended when the effect ends, and the tattoo fades. A creature can’t benefit from more than one Shared Ink tattoo at a time.
At the end of a long rest, you inscribe a magical tattoo on a willing creature.

The creature can activate the tattoo as a bonus action, for a duration of 1 minute. Once activated, the tattoo’s magic is expended when the effect ends, and the tattoo fades. A creature can’t benefit from more than one Shared Ink tattoo at a time.

You gain further control of the ink in your body, allowing you to slip away when danger strikes. When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Ink Trail. When you use Ink Step, you leave behind a faint trail of swirling ink in your previous space until the start of your next turn. This area counts as lightly obscured for creatures within 5 feet, granting them disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space. Ink Trail creates lightly obscured terrain in your previous space until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).

description.p: When you take damage while concentrating on a spell, your tattoos flare to life, defending your magic. You can choose to automatically succeed on the Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration.

In addition, inky tendrils lash out from your tattoos. All creatures of your choice in a 10-foot emanation must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 2d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you take a long rest or cast another spell of 3rd level or higher that requires concentration.

Inky tendrils lash out from your tattoos: all creatures of your choice in a 10-foot radius must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 2d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. This feature recharges after you take a long rest or cast another spell of 3rd level or higher that requires concentration.

p.em: 14th-level Order of the Living Grimoire feature

description.p: Your living tattoos resonate with the flow of your spells, spreading their power to others in the heat of battle. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature immediately gains the benefit of one of your Shared Ink tattoos (Ward of Ink, Strike of Ink, or Glyph of Vigor) until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, choose one creature within 30 ft. It immediately gains the benefit of one Shared Ink tattoo until the end of your next turn. This doesn’t expend Shared Ink and activates automatically. Usable {{intelligence:modifier}} times per long rest.
